data.title: Loved this place!
data.text: We came here for dinner one evening super close to them closing, we were on a road trip from out of town, and they were so welcoming and kind! The food was just delicious! They make exquisite dishes and I'd come back if ever in the area again!

data.title: Great food and Great service
data.text:
Went to Pontos with my wife on a early Saturday evening. We were met as we entered the restaurant  by Tiffany who showed us to our table. After getting our drink order and looking at the menu, Tiffany made a few suggestions to help with our decisions. 
We started with the Geek salad which was so fresh and tasteful, followed by the homemadeTzatziki (incredible) and I had this grilled octopus. I must say that I was a little apprehensive about the octopus but it definitely was the highlight of of truly great meal.
My wife had an assortment of a la carte tasters which she said equally wonderful  (she did share a bite or two with me).
If you want true authentic great  Greek food served by friendly wonderful people go to Pontos.

data.title: One of the BEST
data.text: My husband and I were on the road for 3 weeks. We had heard about Pontos Taverna so driving through Ct we decided to give it a try. From the moment we walked in the staff welcomed us with open arms, as if we were family. The food was over the top. I enjoyed every bit didn't want it to end. Everything from the octopus was to die for, along with the salad and lamb chops. My only problem with my meal  was the fact I enjoyed my meals so much that they aren't closer to me. But you can be sure next time I head to CT. I will stop at Pontos for a meal. And  for anyone in the area you must stop in you won't be sorry or leave hungry. You will also have new friends.

data.title: Tempted to Keep Pontos to Myself
data.text:
Being so close to Garden Theater in Norwalk, this place attracts a strong post-movie crowd. But it's so good my husband and I vowed to come back even when we're not going to the movies. It's that good. But it's small, so I am tempted to keep it quiet. That said, you need to know how great this place is. 

Everything we got, down to the orzo nestled next to our pita bread, was outstanding. Best Greek Salad we've ever had. Souvlaki and Gyros just clean-your-plate delicious. Well priced, too. 

Our server, Faith, explained this is all family run. Dad's in the kitchen, kids and cousins are in the front of the house. She even explained the relevance of the term "Pontos" in the restaurant's name.

data.title: Opa!!
data.text: Home run with everything! Greek salad, soup, saganaki, gyro platter! We'll be back!the chicken lemon soup is soothing and has healing properties for any cold or sore throat. Greek salad and their dressing fresh and I wanted to drink it!

data.title: Great Greek Food!
data.text:
Great authentic Greek food, great service, and reasonable prices - it's a trifecta!  

We started with the Greek salad and it was heaven on a plate.  The fried calamari was okay.  I had the gyro platter ,my wife had the chicken souvlaki, and my son had the combination platter.  We all enjoyed our meals. 

It is right next door to the Garden Cinema so weekend diners tend to peak about 1.5 hours before show times and they don't take reservations.

The only complaint is that it gets a bit loud as there are no acoustic absorbent materials in the restaurant (bare floors and low ceilings.)

data.title: nice decor
data.text: nice experience. good service. good food. Need more lamb dishes for a Greek restaurant. would come again with friends

data.title: YOU MUST TRY THIS RESTAURANT!!! PLEASE READ THIS IMMEDIATELY!!!
data.text:
As a business traveler and an avid personal traveler I have eaten at thousands of restaurants all over the world. I have dined at the finest Greek restaurants in New York City (Astoria), Athens Greece, Tarpon Springs Fl. etc. This is not only the BEST GREEK RESTAURANT IN THE WORLD, but it is the BEST RESTAURANT I HAVE EVER BEEN TO IN THE WORLD!!!

 I do not know the owners personally, I am not being paid to leave this review but I felt comopelled to spread the word and share this incredible restaurant with others. I am giving you an unbiased authentic review. I have been to Pontos dozens of times now and each time the food quality and taste is consistently superb! It is hidden on a small side street in Norwalk and I implore you to seek it out for the meal of a lifetime! You will not be disappointed! Everything on the menu is sensational from the soup to the salads with my all time favorite being the pork or chicken Tigania. Incredible!!!

data.title: Still our favorite Greek place
data.text: While other Greek restaurant have popped up...none can compare to this what I call " clean food" authentic..every bite at our table last week was yum yum yum wow!  The salads are the best the Greek salad has homemade fresh feta cheese big chunks and great EVOO dressing with herbs..the red red tomatos always...the stuffed spiced beef with cheese is a hit as the chicken souvlaki platter with great orzo! Am I saying great to much.?  Oh well it just is..a perfect menu ...fami,y owned just great people...

data.title: it's greek to me
data.text:
good food reasonably priced.
very crowded when movie theater lets out.  adjacent construction causes parking problem and quite loud ambience.

data.title: genuine
data.text: Authentic, genuine, Greek food. Bold flavors, unique dishes, fantastic Greek wines, reasonable prices. A bit noisy.

data.title: Simple , but tasty .
data.text: We stopped here for dinner on our way to NYC , it was a good choice . Place is very simple , but food is very good . I had the best Greek salad and chicken lemon soup ever and my friend almost kicked his employ  gyro plate . It's not a place for a special evening or anything , but great for a simple dinner . Thank you Pontos Taverna )

data.title: Reliving our Honeymoon
data.text: Pontos was wonderful. They have the Saganaki that we had in Crete and could not find anywhere else. Greek beer, stuffed grape leaves, and great Mousaka.  Go here and you wont go wrong.

data.title: Wonderful place
data.text: Simple but consistently high quality greek food served by a warm and friendly staff and at very reasonable prices.  The place is extremely clean.  Love it!

data.title: Great Friendly Service
data.text:
The staff is friendly provides great service.

The menu was not extensive.  

The food was good but not great.

We will try it again

data.title: Very good, casual Greek restaurant
data.text:
We eat at Pontos once or twice a month - we love the staff and the food. It is a very friendly, family owned restaurant. We always order the same thing - the cucumber tomato salad, and then the gyro platter. It is enough for two and is delicious. The skewers are also excellent. 
You can order everything either a la carte or as a platter. The platters come with orzo, a small salad, and pita bread.
If you want a nice, relaxed, casual meal, do try Pontos Taverna.

data.title: very tasty
data.text: By we enjoyed a nice sampling of foods on a combo platter with lamb chops, tzaziki, and other meat dishes after an octopus appetizer and then had nice dessert. Greek wine was good too. Service is good and it does get crowded and noisy; go early.

data.title: Fantastic Greek Food, wonderful Staff, reasonable prices.
data.text: We have come here a number of times over the years after a movie next door and have to say that it is truly consistent in the quality of food, the friendly and warm service and just a small family owned business that i hope thrives in years to come.  The grilled octopus terrific, as was the Branzino and greek salad.  YOu can order things ala carte and build your own dish.  I had the small greek salad with a chicken skewer.  For starters the dolmas were so fresh and tasty we had two orders!  We will go back even when we aren't at the movies.

data.title: Limited menu but what they offer is fantastic!
data.text: Really enjoyed the meal here.  Though the menu is limited, the place has perfected what is on the menu.  Service was warm, friendly and attentive.  The only problem is parking.  With a large construction project taking place across the street, parking is a bit limited.  Highly recommended!

data.title: Love love love
data.text:
We go at least once a week... The chicken souvlaki is to die for the Greek salad is the best I ever had they have authentic food..
Giant kidney beans in sauce and great gyro sandwich... You can order platter of orzo with stuff beef paddies so tasty..
Love the vin d create wine
Don't forget the rice pudding and baklava 
Place fills up on weekends..
